memberdef.argsstring: (Context &owner, System &system, Integrator &integrator, Platform *platform, const std::map< std::string, std::string > &properties)
memberdef.name: ContextImpl

detaileddescription.para: Create an ContextImpl for a Context;
Get the Context for which this is the implementation.
Get System being simulated in this context.
Get Integrator being used to by this context.
Get the Platform implementation being used for computations.
Get the current time (in picoseconds).
Set the current time (in picoseconds).
Get the positions of all particles.

parameterdescription.para: on exit, this contains the particle positions

detaileddescription.para: Set the positions of all particles.

parameterdescription.para: a vector containg the particle positions

detaileddescription.para: Get the velocities of all particles.

parameterdescription.para: on exit, this contains the particle velocities

detaileddescription.para: Set the velocities of all particles.

parameterdescription.para: a vector containg the particle velocities

detaileddescription.para: Get the current forces on all particles.

parameterdescription.para: on exit, this contains the forces

detaileddescription.para: Get the set of all adjustable parameters and their values
Get the value of an adjustable parameter. If there is no parameter with the specified name, this throws an exception.

parameterdescription.para: the name of the parameter to get

detaileddescription.para: Set the value of an adjustable parameter. If there is no parameter with the specified name, this throws an exception.

parameterdescription.para: the name of the parameter to set
the value of the parameter

detaileddescription.para: Get the vectors defining the axes of the periodic box (measured in nm). They will affect any Force that uses periodic boundary conditions.
Currently, only rectangular boxes are supported. This means that a, b, and c must be aligned with the x, y, and z axes respectively. Future releases may support arbitrary triclinic boxes.

parameterdescription.para: the vector defining the first edge of the periodic box
the vector defining the second edge of the periodic box
the vector defining the third edge of the periodic box

detaileddescription.para: Set the vectors defining the axes of the periodic box (measured in nm). They will affect any Force that uses periodic boundary conditions.
Currently, only rectangular boxes are supported. This means that a, b, and c must be aligned with the x, y, and z axes respectively. Future releases may support arbitrary triclinic boxes.

parameterdescription.para: the vector defining the first edge of the periodic box
the vector defining the second edge of the periodic box
the vector defining the third edge of the periodic box

detaileddescription.para: Update the positions of particles so that all distance constraints are satisfied. This also recomputes the locations of all virtual sites.

parameterdescription.para: the distance tolerance within which constraints must be satisfied.

detaileddescription.para: Update the velocities of particles so the net velocity of each constrained distance is zero.

parameterdescription.para: the velocity tolerance within which constraints must be satisfied.

detaileddescription.para: Recompute the locations of all virtual sites. There is rarely a reason to call this, since virtual sites are also updated by applyConstraints(). This is only for the rare situations when you want to enforce virtual sites but not constraints.
Recalculate all of the forces in the system and/or the potential energy of the system (in kJ/mol). After calling this, use getForces() to retrieve the forces that were calculated.

parameterdescription.para: true if forces should be calculated
true if the energy should be calculated
a set of bit flags for which force groups to include. Group i will be included if (groups&(1<<i)) != 0. The default value includes all groups.

simplesect.para: the potential energy of the system, or 0 if includeEnergy is false

detaileddescription.para: Get the set of force group flags that were passed to the most recent call to calcForcesAndEnergy().
Calculate the kinetic energy of the system (in kJ/mol).
This should be called at the start of each time step. It calls updateContextState() on each ForceImpl in the system, allowing them to modify the values of state variables.
Get the list of ForceImpls belonging to this ContextImpl.
Get the list of ForceImpls belonging to this ContextImpl.
Get the platform-specific data stored in this context.
Get the platform-specific data stored in this context.
Set the platform-specific data stored in this context.
Get a list of the particles in each molecules in the system. Two particles are in the same molecule if they are connected by constraints or bonds.
Create a checkpoint recording the current state of the Context.

parameterdescription.para: an output stream the checkpoint data should be written to

detaileddescription.para: Load a checkpoint that was written by createCheckpoint().

parameterdescription.para: an input stream the checkpoint data should be read from

detaileddescription.para: This is invoked by the Integrator when it is deleted. This is needed to ensure the cleanup process is done correctly, since we don't know whether the Integrator or Context will be deleted first.

memberdef.argsstring: (int particle, int molecule, std::vector< int > &particleMolecule, std::vector< std::vector< int > > &particleBonds)
memberdef.name: tagParticlesInMolecule

detaileddescription.para: This is the internal implementation of a Context.
